column4: having some problems with laptop lid actions, vaio sz/ubuntu 12.04... any ideas, anyone?
how much swap space do you have, and how much physical memory?
2GB
2GB for both?
suspending a machine will almost certainly require >1.1*RAM. you have to flush RAM when suspending. also, suspend and hibernate support varies widely depending on how an OEM implemented it.
IOW, 2GB swap for 2GB RAM may not be enough. and it may not work at all.
my RAM is 2GB... while flushing the RAM rings no bells to me...
it's the same on all OSes. when you suspend, power to the physical RAM is cut. the contents have to go somewhere or they get lost. it gets paged out to disk.
do you *need* suspend? is hibernate enough?
again ... suspend requires a minimum swap of >1.1*RAM.
one-point-one multiplied by the amount of physical RAM
yes. and even then it may not work at all, depending on Sony's implementation.
it may require fiddling with pm-utils. it may only hibernate and not suspend.
it worked in Linux with no swap?
i have never heard of a true Linux install (not zombified Wubi stuff) not needing swap to suspend.
might.
weren't you asking about this last week?
are you now a pm-utils expert?
as suggested last week, you need to install the pm-utils package and begin to learn its machinations.
don't want to sound grumpy, but if i started to learn everything from scratch... i would build my own OS, and not blast my brain about bugs in ubuntu
